content.description: Start as Andrews Problem. Instead of topping out. Continue on to Andrews Jump and Finish there.
content.protection: Pretty safe landings so its doable by yourself but a spotter and 1-2 pad would be optimal
content.location: Starts at Andrews Problem.. heel hook your way to Andrews Jump and topout

content.description:
Hand-jam along the roof crack in a dihedral formed by two boulders.  

  If you know how to jam, it's pure joy.
content.location: 20 or so feet before the Andrew boulder, in the talus field. The left boulder of the dihedral is the Kinetic Energy boulder.

content.description: From a sloper-undercling at the chest level, huck up to a couple of tiny crimps on the face. Once established, make your way to slopers at the lip. Great rock and fun movement.
content.protection: A couple pads plus an attentive spotter so you don't tumble downhill.
content.location: It's located right by the cliff as you scramble over the Andrews boulder.
Start as for The Buddha, but do not continue up to the jugs, instead at the corner move out to small edges to the right and top out above a vertical seam

content.description: There are three tiers of roofs formed by three boulders to the left of the Andrew boulder.  From the left-hand side of the middle roof, sit start with your right hand on a sharp right flake and your left hand on the lip of the roof.  Grunt your way along the lip of the cave to the right and top out.
content.protection: Spotter to keep you from falling off the lower roof to the ground if you fall backward while pulling the roof.
content.location:
Under the roof formed by the boulder leaning up against Andrew boulder above the lower roof boulder.                

Hmnn (V1)

content.description: The first couple of moves are the crux.
content.location: Above the Andrew area on the left, locate a blunt flake system.  Sit start under the flake to the right on slopey holds; everything is 'on' for feet.  Reach out the blunt flake, over the roof to a fun top out

content.description: Start with both hands on the crimp rail about half-way into the cave. Either dyno or use powerful knee-bar beta to reach the horn-shaped hold and continue on easy moves out over the lip. Starting deeper into the cave bumps the grade to v10/11 (Crouching Dragon). Starting on the horn makes it V4 (the Sensationalist)
content.protection: Bunch of pads - landing is blocky
content.location: Right over the Buddha problem - scramble uphill and you will see a cave with a rail splitting it. It is to the right of Hetel Sketel.

content.description: Start with left hand on a sloping edge and right hand on a crimp to the right and work your way up into "Dragon Turns"
content.location: Starts in the little hole below "Dragon Turns"

content.protection: a couple pads and spotters are probably a good idea
content.location: On the left  side of Andrew area, on the belly like feature, start with hands and feet on the belly.  Slap and hook your way out to the point, move up to a left hand crimp and top out on good holds

content.description: This is a cool problem that moves off the lower rail of Andrews Problem for a crimp and several slopers. It's a bit reachy and height dependent. The moves are quite a bit harder then Who is Andrew but it's much less pumpy. I'd say it feels v5 possibly v6 depending on height (reachy moves are my style); it could be very very hard to impossible if you're under a certain height. Try it out, it's a lot of fun.

The start is the same as for the "Andrew boulder problem."  Traverse out left on the rail system until you get to the last section of big holds.   

  Next, move out towards a pair of small underclings in the back of the tiered roof above you. Once you gain the underclinging slopers, reach out to small crimps on the lip of this huge roof. From here just one or two campus moves lead you to better holds and final the top-out. 

  It's sick fun line that is often overlooked on this boulder.  It's a classic must do!!!!
content.protection: Pads and Spotters.  Two would be best.  Spotters should be careful not to get kicked in the face!!!!!!!!

content.description: Starts under the south face of the boulder
content.location: Jump to a mail slot on the face then top out

content.description: Walk up the slab on the east side of the roof, grab the hold closest to the dihedral, paw and heel hook your way out the rail, and top out on good holds.
Located a few minutes down the Carriage Road, home to such classics as the Buddha Problems, Andrew, and Andrew's Roof
